intro: Megalastrum marginatum, commonly known as the marginate megalastrum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves with wavy margins. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with contrasting veins. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
